channel.title: How to use ::master
channel.description: im a owner on my server but i cant get no commands to work like ::master ::edit and so on

item.title: How to use ::master
item.dc:creator: @Shadowland Shadowland
item.description:
@Shadowland wrote:

Check client.java in your server code.

There might be something like:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("someusername"))

Where as you’d have to change “someusername” to your own or change it to something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 4)

4 is an example. Change that to whatever your admin rank number is (usually 3 I think)

Read full topic

item.title: How to use ::master
item.dc:creator: @wetodded wetodded
item.description:
@wetodded wrote:

Are you sure that the server you are using has the commands on the server?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 11, 2008, 12:51:16 PM[/size][hr]Although if you need to know what the command is for the ::master it is

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”) && playerRights >= 2)
{
addSkillXP(14910000, 0);
addSkillXP(14910000, 1);
addSkillXP(14910000, 2);
addSkillXP(14910000, 3);
addSkillXP(14910000, 4);
addSkillXP(14910000, 5);
addSkillXP(14910000, 6);
addSkillXP(14910000, 7);
addSkillXP(14910000, 8);
addSkillXP(14910000, 9);
addSkillXP(14910000, 10);
addSkillXP(14910000, 11);
addSkillXP(14910000, 12);
addSkillXP(14910000, 13);
addSkillXP(14910000, 14);
addSkillXP(14910000, 15);
addSkillXP(14910000, 16);
addSkillXP(14910000, 17);
addSkillXP(14910000, 18);
addSkillXP(14910000, 19);
addSkillXP(14910000, 20);
addSkillXP(14910000, 21);
addSkillXP(14910000, 22);
addSkillXP(14910000, 23);
sendMessage(""+ playerName +" … your a nerd.");
}
